headline: Investor says some Magnificent Seven stocks ‘overly punished’
summary: STORY: Lynch points to companies like Alphabet, Meta and Nvidia as attractive, because they "are still central, they are still guiding for really higher earnings growth." But he’s more cautious on others."We want to see free cash flow yields that are still at least a few percentage points and you know, a name like Oracle, which is growing really fast, that has a negative free cash flow right now is not something we're interested in. Something like Microsoft, that still has a few points, that's okay."

raw.headline: Investor says some Magnificent Seven stocks ‘overly punished’

Something like Microsoft, that still has a few points, that's okay."

headline: Nvidia to sell Meta millions of chips in multiyear deal
summary: Nvidia on Tuesday said it has signed a multiyear deal to sell Meta Platforms millions of its current ‌and future artificial intelligence chips, including central processing units that compete ‌with products from Intel and Advanced Micro Devices.  Nvidia did not disclose a value for the deal, ​but said it includes its current Blackwell chips as well as its forthcoming Rubin AI chips.  It also includes standalone installations of its Grace and Vera central processors.

raw.headline: Nvidia to sell Meta millions of chips in multiyear deal
raw.summary: Nvidia on Tuesday said it has signed a multiyear deal to sell Meta Platforms millions of its current ‌and future artificial intelligence chips, including central processing units that compete ‌with products from Intel and Advanced Micro Devices.  Nvidia did not disclose a value for the deal, ​but said it includes its current Blackwell chips as well as its forthcoming Rubin AI chips.  It also includes standalone installations of its Grace and Vera central processors.

headline: Meta Will Buy Millions of Nvidia Chips for AI Build-Out
summary: Meta Platforms is expanding its relationship with Nvidia in a new deal that will see the social-media company purchase tens of billions of dollars’ worth of chips and other hardware for its artificial-intelligence needs.  Meta plans to use millions of Nvidia’s Blackwell and Rubin GPUs and a “significant deployment” of Nvidia’s Grace and Vera CPUs to build out its data centers, the companies said Tuesday.  Although Meta has been a customer of Nvidia for more than a decade, the new initiative is expected to more closely tie Meta, one of the biggest developers of AI models, to Nvidia’s hardware and software ecosystem.

raw.headline: Meta Will Buy Millions of Nvidia Chips for AI Build-Out
raw.summary: Meta Platforms is expanding its relationship with Nvidia in a new deal that will see the social-media company purchase tens of billions of dollars’ worth of chips and other hardware for its artificial-intelligence needs.  Meta plans to use millions of Nvidia’s Blackwell and Rubin GPUs and a “significant deployment” of Nvidia’s Grace and Vera CPUs to build out its data centers, the companies said Tuesday.  Although Meta has been a customer of Nvidia for more than a decade, the new initiative is expected to more closely tie Meta, one of the biggest developers of AI models, to Nvidia’s hardware and software ecosystem.

headline: Analysis-Europe squares up to Big Tech, risking ire of Washington
summary: MADRID, Feb 17 (Reuters) - European nations are ratcheting up the pressure on social media companies, responding to a public outcry over child safety fears but risking a backlash from the United States, home ‌to the likes of Facebook and Elon Musk's X. Spain on Tuesday ordered prosecutors to investigate Facebook owner Meta, X and TikTok for ‌allegedly spreading AI-generated child sexual images, after a similar move in Britain.

raw.headline: Analysis-Europe squares up to Big Tech, risking ire of Washington
raw.summary: MADRID, Feb 17 (Reuters) - European nations are ratcheting up the pressure on social media companies, responding to a public outcry over child safety fears but risking a backlash from the United States, home ‌to the likes of Facebook and Elon Musk's X. Spain on Tuesday ordered prosecutors to investigate Facebook owner Meta, X and TikTok for ‌allegedly spreading AI-generated child sexual images, after a similar move in Britain.

headline: Apple Ramps Up Work on Glasses, Pendant, and Camera AirPods for AI Era
summary: The company is ramping up work on smart glasses, a pendant that can be pinned to a shirt or worn as a necklace, and AirPods with expanded AI capabilities, according to people with knowledge of the plans.  Each of the products, which will be linked to Apple’s iPhone, depends on a camera system with varying capabilities, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the plans haven’t been announced.  A spokesperson for Cupertino, California-based Apple declined to comment.

raw.headline: Apple Ramps Up Work on Glasses, Pendant, and Camera AirPods for AI Era

A spokesperson for Cupertino, California-based Apple declined to comment.

headline: Tech Weekly: OpenAI unhappy with DeepSeek, Amazon Leo lifts off
summary: STORY: From OpenAI's DeepSeek frustrations to Amazon's satellite lift-off, this is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyOpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.Russia has completely blocked WhatsApp.The Kremlin accused the Meta-owned messenger app of not complying with local law.Moscow suggested Russians should instead turn to a state-backed 'national messenger' called MAX.But critics argue MAX is a surveillance tool, while Russian authorities deny this.Britain could ban children under-16 from social media as early as this year.It could also close a loophole which left some AI chatbots outside safety rules.It's part of government efforts to respond faster to digital risks.Spain, Greece and Slovenia have also said they're working on bans after Australia became the first country in the world to block under 16s from social media.Europe launched its new Ariane 64 heavy-lift rocket.It carried 32 Amazon Leo satellites with it and sent them into low earth orbit.it marked the debut of the most powerful version of the Ariane 6 launcher developed by Airbus and Safran joint venture Arianespace.Amazon Leo is a low Earth orbit satellite network designed to provide internet service to customers beyond the reach of existing terrestrial networks - and could rival SpaceX's Starlink.And Samsung said it's started to ship its most advanced HBM4 chips to unamed customers.It's trying to catch up to rivals supplying critical parts for Nvidia AI accelerators.The global rush to build AI data centers has fueled demand for such chips.The semiconductors feed massive amounts of data to the accelerators for training and running AI models.

raw.headline: Tech Weekly: OpenAI unhappy with DeepSeek, Amazon Leo lifts off
raw.summary: STORY: From OpenAI's DeepSeek frustrations to Amazon's satellite lift-off, this is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyOpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.Russia has completely blocked WhatsApp.The Kremlin accused the Meta-owned messenger app of not complying with local law.Moscow suggested Russians should instead turn to a state-backed 'national messenger' called MAX.But critics argue MAX is a surveillance tool, while Russian authorities deny this.Britain could ban children under-16 from social media as early as this year.It could also close a loophole which left some AI chatbots outside safety rules.It's part of government efforts to respond faster to digital risks.Spain, Greece and Slovenia have also said they're working on bans after Australia became the first country in the world to block under 16s from social media.Europe launched its new Ariane 64 heavy-lift rocket.It carried 32 Amazon Leo satellites with it and sent them into low earth orbit.it marked the debut of the most powerful version of the Ariane 6 launcher developed by Airbus and Safran joint venture Arianespace.Amazon Leo is a low Earth orbit satellite network designed to provide internet service to customers beyond the reach of existing terrestrial networks - and could rival SpaceX's Starlink.And Samsung said it's started to ship its most advanced HBM4 chips to unamed customers.It's trying to catch up to rivals supplying critical parts for Nvidia AI accelerators.The global rush to build AI data centers has fueled demand for such chips.The semiconductors feed massive amounts of data to the accelerators for training and running AI models.

headline: BofA Survey Shows Investor Worry Over Capex Race at Record High
summary: While investors participating in the survey are the most bullish they’ve been since June 2021, about 35% warned that corporations are overinvesting, the highest proportion seen in data going back two decades, strategist Michael Hartnett wrote in a note.  Record levels of capital expenditure are expected this year, with the four biggest US technology companies together forecasting spending of about $650 billion in 2026.  Microsoft Corp. plunged the most in almost six years on concerns about how long it might take for investments to pay off, while Meta Platforms Inc. jumped more than 11% after it revealed its ambitious AI spending plans.

headline: India's Adani to invest $100 billion in AI-ready data centres by 2035
summary: Adani Enterprises said on Tuesday that the group will invest $100 billion to build renewable ‌energy-powered AI-ready data centres by 2035, as it seeks ‌to create the world's largest integrated data centre platform and establish India ​as a leader in the global AI race.  The investment is expected to spur an additional $150 billion in spending over the next decade across several related industries including sovereign cloud platforms ‌and server manufacturing, the ⁠company said.  Adani's investment will create a $250 billion AI infrastructure ecosystem in India over the decade, ⁠it added.

The investment is expected to spur an additional $150 billion in spending over the next decade across several related industries including sovereign cloud platforms ‌and server manufacturing, the ⁠company said.  Adani's investment will create a $250 billion AI infrastructure ecosystem in India over the decade, ⁠it added.

headline: Wall Street heads lower in premarket trading as tech stocks appear poised for more losses
summary: Wall Street pointed toward more losses before the opening bell Tuesday, kicking off a holiday-shortened week of trading that will bring more earnings reports and some highly-anticipated economic releases.  Futures for the S&P 500 were down 0.5% in premarket trading, while futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average edged 0.3% lower.  Tech stocks have been waxing and waning with fluctuations in confidence over massive investments in AI, which appears to have carried over into this holiday-shortened trading week.

Tech stocks have been waxing and waning with fluctuations in confidence over massive investments in AI, which appears to have carried over into this holiday-shortened trading week.

headline: Meta Shares 'Truth' About Troubled AI Chatbot That Overwhelmingly Failed To Protect Minors: 'Did Not Launch This Product'
